name: $getDB
description: Returns all stored identifiers in the database

name: $searchDB
description: Retrieves variables associated with your inputs.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable from which you want to retrieve the value.

args.name: id
args.description: The unique identifier of the user, guild, channel, or any other type.

args.name: type
args.description: The type or category of the variable.

args.name: value
args.description: The value associated with the variable.

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The unique identifier of the guild to which the member, channel, or role belongs.

name: $channelLeaderboard
description: Creates a leaderboard specific to channels based on a variable.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable used to create the leaderboard.

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The unique identifier of the guild for which you want to retrieve channel variables.

args.name: sort type
args.description: The sorting order for the leaderboard, either ascending (asc) or descending (desc).

args.name: max
args.description: The maximum number of entries to display per page on the leaderboard.

args.name: page
args.description: The specific page number of the leaderboard you wish to view.

args.name: separator
args.description: The separator to be utilized between each row in the leaderboard.

args.name: envValue
args.description: The variable name to employ for $env, facilitating the retrieval of identifiers and values using $env[<name>;id] and $env[<name>;value] respectively.

args.name: envPosition
args.description: The variable name utilized for $env to acquire the position using $env[<name>].

args.name: code
args.description: Code executed for each row. Remember to use $return, otherwise it will not return anything.

name: $deleteChannelVar
description: Removes a value from a variable associated with a channel.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable.

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The unique identifier of the value to delete.

name: $getChannelLeaderboardLength
description: Returns the total number of entries in a channel leaderboard.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable to query

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild ID for which to retrieve channel variables

args.name: length
args.description: The number of users per page

args.name: decimals
args.description: Specify whether to return decimals for more precise results (default: false)

name: $getChannelLeaderboardValue
description: Fetches the position of a channel in the leaderboard of a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable to query

args.name: sort type
args.description: The sort order for the leaderboard, either ascending (asc) or descending (desc)

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The channel ID of the value

name: $getChannelVar
description: Retrieves the value of a variable associated with a channel

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable to query

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The channel ID for which to retrieve the variable value

args.name: default
args.description: The default value to return if the identifier doesn't exist in the variable

name: $setChannelVar
description: Assigns a value to a variable associated with a channel

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable to set the value in

args.name: value
args.description: The value to be assigned

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The channel ID for which to set the variable value

name: $channelCooldown
description: Imposes a cooldown period for a command within a specific channel.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command for which you wish to set a cooldown.

args.name: duration
args.description: The length of time the cooldown will last.

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute when the cooldown is in effect.

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The unique identifier (id) of the channel to apply the cooldown to.

name: $deleteChannelCooldown
description: Deletes a cooldown of a given channel

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you want the cooldown to get deleted

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The channel's id you want to delete the cooldown

name: $deleteGlobalCooldown
description: Deletes a cooldown of a given global

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you want the cooldown to get deleted

name: $deleteGuildCooldown
description: Deletes a cooldown of a given guild

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you want the cooldown to get deleted

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild's id you want to delete the cooldown

name: $deleteMemberCooldown
description: Deletes a cooldown of a given member

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you want the cooldown to get deleted

args.name: member ID
args.description: The member's id you want to delete the cooldown

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild of the identifier

name: $deleteUserCooldown
description: Deletes a cooldown of a given user

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you want the cooldown to get deleted

args.name: user ID
args.description: The user's id you want to delete the cooldown

name: $getChannelCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for a channel

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to check the cooldown

args.name: channel ID
args.description: The channel id to get its cooldown

name: $getGlobalCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for a global

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to check the cooldown

name: $getGuildCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for a guild

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to check the cooldown

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild id to get its cooldown

name: $getMemberCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for a member

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to check the cooldown

args.name: member ID
args.description: The member id to get its cooldown

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild of the identifier

name: $getUserCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for a user

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to check the cooldown

args.name: user ID
args.description: The user id to get its cooldown

name: $globalCooldown
description: Adds a cooldown to a command for a global

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to add a cooldown

args.name: duration
args.description: The duration of the cooldown

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute if the cooldown is active

name: $guildCooldown
description: Adds a cooldown to a command for a guild

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to add a cooldown

args.name: duration
args.description: The duration of the cooldown

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute if the cooldown is active

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild id to assign the cooldown to

name: $memberCooldown
description: Adds a cooldown to a command for a member

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to add a cooldown

args.name: duration
args.description: The duration of the cooldown

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute if the cooldown is active

args.name: member ID
args.description: The member id to assign the cooldown to

args.name: guild ID
args.description: The guild of the identifier

name: $userCooldown
description: Adds a cooldown to a command for a user

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the command you are trying to add a cooldown

args.name: duration
args.description: The duration of the cooldown

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute if the cooldown is active

args.name: user ID
args.description: The user id to assign the cooldown to

name: $data
description: Retrieves data that has been set or deleted for a record during create and delete events

args.name: type
args.description: The type of data you want to retrieve

name: $newData
description: Retrieves the new data that has been updated for a record during an update event

args.name: type
args.description: The type of data you want to retrieve

name: $oldData
description: Retrieves the old data that has been updated for a record during an update event

args.name: type
args.description: The type of data you want to retrieve

name: $getUserVar
description: Retrieves the value of a specified variable for a user.

args.name: variable name
args.description: The name of the variable.

args.name: user ID
args.description: The identifier of the user.

args.name: default value
args.description: The default value if the identifier doesn't exist in the variable.

args.name: value

args.name: user ID

name: $userLeaderboard
description: Creates a user leaderboard for a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: sort type
args.description: The sort type for the leaderboard, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending)

args.name: max
args.description: The maximum number of rows per page

args.name: page
args.description: The page number

args.name: separator
args.description: The separator to use for each row

args.name: envValue
args.description: The variable name to use for $env. Retrieve the id with $env[<name>;id] and the value with $env[<name>;value]

args.name: envPosition
args.description: The variable name to use for $env. Retrieve the position with $env[<name>]

args.name: code
args.description: Code to execute for each row. Remember to use $return, otherwise it will not return anything.
